result.markdown:
---
title: "Tabela de contingência"
author: "Nívia"
format: html
---


# Variáveis categóricas e tabelas de contingência

Para variaveis resposta categoricas, não se tira a média dos dados, ao inves disso, se monta uma tabela de contigencia e visualiza por meio de grafico de barras/colunas, pois se é sada para ver frequencia de ocorrencias, quando se tem variáveis categóricas nominais.


::: {.cell hash='Aula15_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_5861711ce0c8f2e22ae5a04055df5db6'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
library(dplyr)
library(readxl)
library(ggplot2)
library(janitor)
library(epifitter)
```
:::


Dados: Quantas ocorrências tem em cada ano. Cruzando duas variáveis. Quantas espécies dos dados tem em cada ano (função table)


::: {.cell hash='Aula15_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_18e1f39f83dab2b77748c714190e47b8'}

```{.r .cell-code}
survey <- read_excel("dados-diversos.xlsx","survey")
survey |>
  count(year)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 3 × 2
   year     n
  <dbl> <int>
1  2009   265
2  2010   216
3  2011   185
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
q <- table(survey$residue, survey$species)
```
:::

::: {.cell hash='Aula15_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_f643d10c3729637d480f88ade35e8420'}

```{.r .cell-code}
#library(janitor)
survey |>
  tabyl(year, species)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
 year Fgra Fspp
 2009  225   40
 2010  187   29
 2011  140   45
```
:::
:::


**Pacote janitor**: Para dar os valores em porcentagem usa-se a função adorn_percentages().


::: {.cell hash='Aula15_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_474af174dd1601a04f7bb02f460a414b'}

```{.r .cell-code}
survey |>
  filter(residue != "NA") |>
  count(residue, species) |>
  ggplot(aes(residue, n, fill = species))+
  geom_col()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula15_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


Teste q quadrado:


::: {.cell hash='Aula15_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_15d04614774ca6d006bb5d7aa4da1592'}

```{.r .cell-code}
q <- table(survey$residue, survey$species)
chisq.test(q)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Pearson's Chi-squared test with Yates' continuity correction

data:  q
X-squared = 1.1997, df = 1, p-value = 0.2734
```
:::
:::


Hipótese nula: as populações são iguais.

Usa-se o fisher.test(q) quando o número de observações é baixo, algo em torno de 6 ou 7.

A severidade é influenciada pelo resíduo?


::: {.cell hash='Aula15_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_1402aada1606f76632a0c164ad65db49'}

```{.r .cell-code}
q <- table(survey$residue, survey$inc_class)
chisq.test(q)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Pearson's Chi-squared test with Yates' continuity correction

data:  q
X-squared = 2.6165, df = 1, p-value = 0.1058
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
survey|>
  filter(residue != "NA") |>
  count(residue, inc_class) |>
  ggplot(aes(residue, n, fill = inc_class))+
  geom_col()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula15_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


Pelo p valor, a classe de severidade independe do resto cultura, ou seja, o resto cultural não influencia na severidade.

Novo conjunto de dados:


::: {.cell hash='Aula15_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-7_813d2c0aeb7e1700c18bed5ad849989b'}

```{.r .cell-code}
curve <- read_excel("dados-diversos.xlsx", "curve")

curve2 <- curve |> 
  group_by(Irrigation, day) |>
  summarize(mean_severity = mean(severity),
            sd_severity = sd(severity))

  curve2 |>
    ggplot(aes(day, mean_severity, color = Irrigation))+
    geom_point()+
    geom_errorbar(aes(ymin = mean_severity - sd_severity, ymax = mean_severity + sd_severity, width = 0.01))+
    geom_line()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula15_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
  curve3 <- curve |>
    group_by(Irrigation, rep) |>
    summarise(audpc = AUDPC(day, severity, 
                            y_proportion = F)) |>
    pivot_wider(1, names_from = Irrigation,
              values_from = audpc)
  
  t.test(curve3$Drip, curve$Furrow)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	One Sample t-test

data:  curve3$Drip
t = 51.206, df = 2, p-value = 0.0003812
alternative hypothesis: true mean is not equal to 0
95 percent confidence interval:
 12.26473 14.51493
sample estimates:
mean of x 
 13.38983 
```
:::
:::


# Exercício prático:

-   Carregando o conjunto de dados, mutando a variável lesion size de categórica para numerica, agrupando as variáveis e resumindo os dados:


::: {.cell hash='Aula15_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-8_d1b5ab8f66c11bcb0edd6da86bf64cd2'}

```{.r .cell-code}
lesion_size <- read_excel("tan-spot-wheat.xlsx", "lesion_size")

lesion2 <- lesion_size |>
mutate(lesion_size = as.numeric(lesion_size)) |>
group_by(cult, silicio, hai) |>
summarise(mean_lesion = mean(lesion_size), sd_lesion = sd(lesion_size))
```
:::


Visualizando os dados graficamente:


::: {.cell hash='Aula15_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-9_9ea31d2a68529e1b36624dcf3b2b69cf'}

```{.r .cell-code}
lesion2 |>
  ggplot(aes(hai, mean_lesion, color = silicio))+
  geom_line()+
  geom_point()+
    geom_errorbar(aes(ymin = mean_lesion - sd_lesion, 
                     ymax = mean_lesion + sd_lesion), 
                     width = 0.01)+
    facet_wrap(~cult)+
  labs(y = "Lesion size (mm)",
       x = "Hours after inoculation (hai)", color = "Treatment")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula15_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


# Análise de área abaixo da curva da doença


::: {.cell hash='Aula15_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-10_23e025c58a8993aa35f927ea36a7cde0'}

```{.r .cell-code}
lesion3 <- lesion_size |>
  mutate(lesion_size = as.numeric(lesion_size)) |>
  group_by(exp, cult, silicio, rep) |>
  summarise(audpc = AUDPC(lesion_size, hai))

lesion3 |>
  ggplot(aes(cult, audpc, color = silicio))+
  geom_boxplot()+
  facet_wrap(~ exp)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula15_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


Teste:


::: {.cell hash='Aula15_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-11_a4ef55217ed0211d1e18f9dbbfc51f46'}

```{.r .cell-code}
aov1<- aov(audpc ~ exp*cult*silicio, data = lesion3)
summary(aov1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
                 Df  Sum Sq Mean Sq F value   Pr(>F)    
exp               1   54544   54544   0.533 0.470257    
cult              1  751290  751290   7.335 0.010281 *  
silicio           1 9051552 9051552  88.377 3.15e-11 ***
exp:cult          1   36717   36717   0.359 0.553089    
exp:silicio       1      49      49   0.000 0.982615    
cult:silicio      1 1412562 1412562  13.792 0.000689 ***
exp:cult:silicio  1  143643  143643   1.403 0.244065    
Residuals        36 3687093  102419                     
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::
:::


Se não der significativo, reduz o modelo:


::: {.cell hash='Aula15_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-12_2fcd4e17b712d8ab94d179ccf18a1589'}

```{.r .cell-code}
aov1<- aov(audpc ~ cult*silicio, data = lesion3)
summary(aov1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
             Df  Sum Sq Mean Sq F value   Pr(>F)    
cult          1  751290  751290   7.662  0.00850 ** 
silicio       1 9051552 9051552  92.315 6.04e-12 ***
cult:silicio  1 1412562 1412562  14.406  0.00049 ***
Residuals    40 3922047   98051                     
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::
:::


Para ver se o modelo está correto, checa as premissas:


::: {.cell hash='Aula15_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-13_87b5ee5ab8b7d1a31f19a0b791a4cde1'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(performance)
check_normality(aov1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Warning: Non-normality of residuals detected (p = 0.003).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
check_heteroscedasticity(aov1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Warning: Heteroscedasticity (non-constant error variance) detected (p = 0.040).
```
:::
:::


Se não atende as premissas, transforma:


::: {.cell hash='Aula15_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-14_8fd94184d4e991bbe258eb84dbd64c8e'}

```{.r .cell-code}
aov1<- aov(sqrt(audpc) ~ cult*silicio, data = lesion3)
summary(aov1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
             Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value   Pr(>F)    
cult          1  294.0   294.0   13.51 0.000712 ***
silicio       1 2363.9  2363.9  108.65 7.81e-13 ***
cult:silicio  1  526.5   526.5   24.20 1.62e-05 ***
Residuals    39  848.6    21.8                     
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
1 observation deleted due to missingness
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
check_normality(aov1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
OK: residuals appear as normally distributed (p = 0.146).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
check_heteroscedasticity(aov1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
OK: Error variance appears to be homoscedastic (p = 0.638).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(emmeans)

m1 <- emmeans(aov1, ~ cult | silicio, type = "response")
m1
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
silicio = Si-:
 cult      response    SE df lower.CL upper.CL
 Horizonte     1440 106.8 39     1233     1664
 Quartzo       1537 110.3 39     1322     1768

silicio = Si+:
 cult      response    SE df lower.CL upper.CL
 Horizonte      897  84.2 39      735     1075
 Quartzo        296  50.7 39      202      407

Confidence level used: 0.95 
Intervals are back-transformed from the sqrt scale 
```
:::
:::
